snippet: A polar geophysicist digs into the city’s depressingly familiar snowpack to reveal a crystalline realm.
abstract: Polar geophysicist Kirsty Tinto is digging into New York City’s depressingly familiar packs of snow and ice and sees much more than city dwellers see; Tinto, from Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory of Columbia University, is exploring a crystalline world of jagged surfaces and translucent pearls, patterns and a hundred different grades and granulations.
lead_paragraph: A polar geophysicist digs into the city’s depressingly familiar snowpack to reveal a crystalline realm.

headline.main: Finding New Worlds in New York City’s Old Snow Piles
headline.print_headline: With Each Layer, Old Snow Draws a Scientist Closer
